WorkItem.ClosedComment: I don't reproduce this issue in the 0.8.2 release. Can you attach a sample project which shows the issue.
WorkItem.Description:
When trying to target ES5 code (like getters and setters) Visual Studio's syntax highlighter says "Property accessors are only available when targeting ES5 or greater". In the project file I am targeting ES5 (<TypeScriptTarget>ES5</TypeScriptTarget>), and the tsc compiler can compile the code without any problems.

Visual studio however is showing the same errors in the Error List.
WorkItem.Summary: VS 2012 syntax highlight is not working with ES5
